section.title: Kernel Profiling
section.remark: WAR STORY: Top network users by PID http://sourceware.org/systemtap/wiki/WSNetTop?highlight=((WarStories))
section.para: This section describes how to profile network activity. provides a glimpse into how much network traffic each process is generating on a machine.
tracks which processes are generating network traffic on the system, and provides the following information about each process:

listitem.para: PID — the ID of the listed process.
UID — user ID. A user ID of 0 refers to the root user.
DEV — which ethernet device the process used to send / receive data (e.g. eth0, eth1)
XMIT_PK — number of packets transmitted by the process
RECV_PK — number of packets received by the process
XMIT_KB — amount of data sent by the process, in kilobytes
RECV_KB — amount of data received by the service, in kilobytes

section.para: provides network profile sampling every 5 seconds. You can change this setting by editing probe timer.ms(5000) accordingly. contains an excerpt of the output from over a 20-second period:
